Package edu.isr.data

Class ParametersManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.isr.data.ParametersManager

  • public class ParametersManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for parsing command line arguments and setting up the parameters necessary for running the experiment.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ParametersManager​()
      Creates a new ParametersManager and sets the command line options.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double getDistMetric​()
      Returns the metric used in order to calculate distances between instances.
      int getNumNeighbors​()
      Returns the number of instances taken as neighbors when applying methods that depend on the notion of closeness.
      double[] getSelectionLevels​()
      Returns the array with the percentages of instances that should be removed.
      java.lang.String getWeightingFunction​()
      Returns the weighting function that will be used to weigh the instances.
      void parseCommandLine​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Parses the command line arguments.
      void setParameters​()
      Loads and sets all the parameters necessary for running the experiment.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParametersManager

        public ParametersManager​()
        Creates a new ParametersManager and sets the command line options.

    • Method Detail

      • parseCommandLine

        public void parseCommandLine​(java.lang.String[] args)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException
        Parses the command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a required argument is not present or if some error occurs while creating the model file.
        org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException - If an error is reached while parsing the command line.

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters​()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException,
                          java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Loads and sets all the parameters necessary for running the experiment.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some error occurs while reading any of the parameter files.
        org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException - If a required parameter was not found in any of the parameter files.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If a parameter that is supposed to be integer is actually a string.

      • getWeightingFunction

        public java.lang.String getWeightingFunction​()
        Returns the weighting function that will be used to weigh the instances. Four functions were implemented: proximity, surrounding, remoteness (which combines the first two), and non-linearity.
        Returns:
        The weighting function.

      • getSelectionLevels

        public double[] getSelectionLevels​()
        Returns the array with the percentages of instances that should be removed. A value 0 means that the instance selection step should not be performed.
        Returns:
        The array containing all selection levels.

      • getDistMetric

        public double getDistMetric​()
        Returns the metric used in order to calculate distances between instances. Two metrics were implemented: Euclidean and fractional.
        Returns:
        The distance metric.

      • getNumNeighbors

        public int getNumNeighbors​()
        Returns the number of instances taken as neighbors when applying methods that depend on the notion of closeness.
        Returns:
        The number of neighbors.
